meanings.definition: The act of following someone closely to observe or imitate them.
meanings.sent1: During the game of hide-and-seek, the children took turns shadowing each other.
meanings.sent2: The detective was shadowing the suspect to gather evidence.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy enjoyed shadowing its owner around the house.
meanings.sent4: The shadowing of the dancer on the stage created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The shadowing of the clouds made the landscape look mysterious.

meanings.definition: A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
meanings.sent1: She noticed a shadowing on the wall as the sun set behind the trees.
meanings.sent2: The cat's shadowing moved along the sidewalk as it walked under the streetlight.
meanings.sent3: The shadowing of the tree branches on the window looked like a spooky hand.
meanings.sent4: The shadowing of the mountain cast a cool relief from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The shadowing of the building made it seem taller than it actually was.

meanings.definition: The practice of observing a professional in order to learn from them.
meanings.sent1: As an intern, she spent hours shadowing the experienced surgeon in the operating room.
meanings.sent2: The student was shadowing the teacher to understand the classroom dynamics.
meanings.sent3: The shadowing of the chef in the kitchen turned into a fun cooking lesson.
meanings.sent4: The shadowing of the artist helped the apprentice improve their painting skills.
meanings.sent5: The shadowing of the CEO taught the young entrepreneur valuable business strategies.
